intro: Zaleya redimita, commonly known as the red rimmed goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, elongated seed pods that mature in the fall. Zaleya redimita is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
